intro: Hylomenes campanulata, commonly known as the Cape daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has a compact, bushy habit with hairy stems and leaves. Its flowers are arranged in compact clusters and bloom throughout the year, making it a popular ornamental plant. Hylomenes campanulata is well adapted to coastal environments, tolerating salt spray and sandy soils.
